item.title: Selling to Tough Customers - Ace of Sales
item.description:
The rainmakers of sales all learn how to handle tough customers – it&rsquo;s one of the rights of passage. My webinar for ambitious sales people reveals how.
Join me for a live session?
Feb 8, 2:00 EST - Follow the link below:
https://www2.gotomeeting.com/register/970482346

Andy Horner Chief Architect Ace of Sales

item.title: Rainbird: Realtime Analytics at Twitter (Strata 2011)
item.description: Introducing Rainbird, Twitter&rsquo;s high volume distributed counting service for realtime analytics, built on Cassandra. This presentation looks at the motivation, design, and uses of Rainbird across Twitter.

item.title: People-Centric vs. Content-Centric: The Copernican Revolution to be a Social Business
item.description: We&rsquo;re all heavily invested in managing our content, but we still have significant business problems we can&rsquo;t address. Consider a new perspective...a people centric one.

item.title: Pricing Pictures
item.description:
Ask people the definition of &rsquo;price and they will tell you the amount you pay for something.
A single fixed value comes to mind.
Except for when price isn&rsquo;t...

item.title: PSFK presents Future Of Real-Time
item.description:
This report has been developed for the United Nations Global Pulse team, a project whose goal is to support governments in understanding what is happening to their most vulnerable populations in real-time. We intend for it to be openly shared around the globe between communities, development agencies, academia and other organizations. Its aim is to highlight the opportunities that exist for organizations, large or small. In particular, the “left field” examples of data capture and use are published in hope of showcasing how organizations can leap- frog IT investment and still significantly improve the monitoring capabilities.
For a free download of this report please visit http://www.psfk.com/future-of-real-time
item.content:encoded:
This report has been developed for the United Nations Global Pulse team, a project whose goal is to support governments in understanding what is happening to their most vulnerable populations in real-time. Its aim is to highlight the opportunities that exist for organizations, large or small. In particular, the “left field” examples of data capture and use are published in hope of showcasing how organizations can leap- frog IT investment and still significantly improve the monitoring capabilities.
For a free download of this report please visit http://www.psfk.com/future-of-real-time

item.title: The 7 Duties of Great Software Professionals
item.description: Some call it &quot;craftsmanship&quot;, others prefer to speak of maturity, competence, excellence or skill. No matter what you call it, the software development community is in need of people with a professional attitude towards their work. From self-motivation to goal setting, from connecting with peers to delegating work, there are a number of crucial behaviors that software testers and developers need to adopt to be able to call themselves &quot;professionals&quot;.
item.content:encoded: Some call it &quot;craftsmanship&quot;, others prefer to speak of maturity, competence, excellence or skill. No matter what you call it, the software development community is in need of people with a professional attitude towards their work. From self-motivation to goal setting, from connecting with peers to delegating work, there are a number of crucial behaviors that software testers and developers need to adopt to be able to call themselves &quot;professionals&quot;.
item.author: jurgenappelo@slideshare.net(jurgenappelo)

media:content.media:title: The 7 Duties of Great Software Professionals
media:content.media:description: Some call it "craftsmanship", others prefer to speak of maturity, competence, excellence or skill. No matter what you call it, the software development community is in need of people with a professional attitude towards their work. From self-motivation to goal setting, from connecting with peers to delegating work, there are a number of crucial behaviors that software testers and developers need to adopt to be able to call themselves "professionals".
media:content.media:text: Some call it "craftsmanship", others prefer to speak of maturity, competence, excellence or skill. No matter what you call it, the software development community is in need of people with a professional attitude towards their work. From self-motivation to goal setting, from connecting with peers to delegating work, there are a number of crucial behaviors that software testers and developers need to adopt to be able to call themselves "professionals".

item.title: LinkedIn demographics and statistics - 2011
item.description: A document about LinkedIn. It shows the number of members worldwide (over 100 million members) with a breakdown by area and countries. It also shows sex and age in area and job fuction/industry distribution worldwide and by area
